title.narrative: 3.3 SYSTEM STRENGTHENING FOR Communication for Development (C4D) INTERVN

description.narrative: By 2016, at least 2 national institutions, GoB and Communication for Development (C4D) partners use data from sentinel sites in 3 upazilas in each of the 20 districts to support the planning andÂ implementation of Communication for Development (C4D) interventions, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2016, deprived community members in 20 selected districts practice key life-saving, care and protective behavours, raised their demand for quality social services and promote social change with equity.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, at least 2 national institutions, GoB and C4D partners use data from sentinel sites in 3 upazilas in each of the 20districts to support the planning and implementation of C4D interventions

description.narrative: In 2016, seven NGO partners, as well as the Ministries of Information and Women and Children&39;s Affairs, used data from the KMOS Study being implemented by UNICEF Bangladesh in partnership with James P Grant School of Public Health, BRAC University | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number and proportion of wards in select UNDAF districts with annual C4D microplans

actual.value: 2016:1,512 wards in plain areas and 335 para centres in Chittagong Hill Tracts or (100%) in select 7 districts and have micro plans.

title.narrative: Number of C4D partners with KAP databases and using data to plan and implement interventions

actual.value: 2016:12 partners, two ministries (Ministry of Information and Ministry of Women and Children Affairs), 3 departments Bangladesh Betar, Department of Mass Communication and Department of Women and Children Affairs have used data to plan and implement interventions since 2013.
